intro: Tovomita goudotiana, commonly known as the Madagascar star apple, is a tropical plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces a fruit that resembles a star, with a white, fleshy pulp surrounding black seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
